newsitem.title: USA: Colonial sticking to allocation amid talk it won't.
newsitem.headline: Colonial sticking to allocation amid talk it won't.

text.p: Colonial Pipeline Co batted down talk this week it was suspending space allocations on its huge Houston-to-New York distillate line, saying it had no plans to stop the planned prorationing through November.
"That's absolutely false," said one Colonial official charged with scheduling issues at the Atlanta-based company, referring to the trader talk.

But oil products traders said that while Colonial may be saying it has no plans of stopping the allocation program, demand in the huge Northeastern heating oil market was not robust enough to justify continuing the allocation.
